Company: Open Door Clinic of Greater Elgin
Description of incident: According to a lawsuit, the clinic stores patient information, including Social Security numbers, addresses, telephone numbers, insurance information and medical history on a file-sharing network. That network is accessible to employees’ personal laptops and home computers. A spreadsheet with information of about 260 of its patients was leaked as a result of the installation and use of file sharing software on computers containing patients’ personally identifiable information.
